verses.kjv: Now after this it came to pass, that David smote the Philistines, and subdued them, and took Gath and her towns out of the hand of the Philistines.
verses.web: After this, David defeated the Philistines and subdued them, and took Gath and its towns out of the hand of the Philistines.
verses.ct: Some time later, David attacked the Philistines and defeated them, capturing the city of Gath and its surrounding towns from Philistine control.

verses.kjv: And he smote Moab; and the Moabites became David’s servants, and brought gifts.
verses.web: He defeated Moab; and the Moabites became servants to David, and brought tribute.
verses.ct: He also defeated Moab. The Moabites became his subjects and paid him tribute.

verses.kjv: And David smote Hadarezer king of Zobah unto Hamath, as he went to stablish his dominion by the river Euphrates.
verses.web: David defeated Hadadezer king of Zobah to Hamath, as he went to establish his dominion by the river Euphrates.
verses.ct: David defeated Hadarezer king of Zobah, near Hamath, while Hadarezer was on his way to secure his control over the territory along the Euphrates River.

verses.kjv: And David took from him a thousand chariots, and seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen: David also houghed all the chariot horses, but reserved of them an hundred chariots.
verses.web: David took from him one thousand chariots, seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen; and David hamstrung all the chariot horses, but reserved of them enough for one hundred chariots.
verses.ct: David captured 1,000 chariots, 7,000 horsemen, and 20,000 foot soldiers from him. He hamstrung all the chariot horses except enough to keep 100 chariots for himself.

verses.kjv: And when the Syrians of Damascus came to help Hadarezer king of Zobah, David slew of the Syrians two and twenty thousand men.
verses.web: When the Syrians of Damascus came to help Hadadezer king of Zobah, David struck twenty-two thousand men of the Syrians.
verses.ct: When the Syrians from Damascus came to help Hadarezer king of Zobah, David killed 22,000 of them.

verses.kjv: Then David put garrisons in Syriadamascus; and the Syrians became David’s servants, and brought gifts. Thus the LORD preserved David whithersoever he went.
verses.web: Then David put garrisons in Syria of Damascus; and the Syrians became servants to David, and brought tribute. LORD gave victory to David wherever he went.
verses.ct: David then stationed garrisons in the Syrian territory around Damascus. The Syrians became his subjects and paid him tribute. The LORD gave David victory everywhere he went.

verses.kjv: And David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadarezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.
verses.web: David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadadezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: David seized the gold shields carried by Hadarezer's officers and brought them back to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Likewise from Tibhath, and from Chun, cities of Hadarezer, brought David very much brass, wherewith Solomon made the brasen sea, and the pillars, and the vessels of brass.
verses.web: From Tibhath and from Cun, cities of Hadadezer, David took very much bronze, with which Solomon made the bronze sea, the pillars, and the vessels of bronze.
verses.ct: From Tibhath and Chun, cities belonging to Hadarezer, David also took a massive amount of bronze. Solomon would later use this bronze to make the great bronze basin, the pillars, and various bronze articles for the temple.

verses.kjv: Now when Tou king of Hamath heard how David had smitten all the host of Hadarezer king of Zobah;
verses.web: When Tou king of Hamath heard that David had struck all the army of Hadadezer king of Zobah,
verses.ct: When Tou king of Hamath heard that David had crushed the entire army of Hadarezer king of Zobah,

verses.kjv: He sent Hadoram his son to king David, to enquire of his welfare, and to congratulate him, because he had fought against Hadarezer, and smitten him; (for Hadarezer had war with Tou;) and with him all manner of vessels of gold and silver and brass.
verses.web: he sent Hadoram his son to king David, to Greet him, and to bless him, because he had fought against Hadadezer and struck him (for Hadadezer had wars with Tou); and he had with him all kinds of vessels of gold and silver and bronze.
verses.ct: he sent his son Hadoram to King David to greet him and congratulate him on his victory over Hadarezer, since Hadarezer had been at war with Tou as well. Hadoram brought with him all kinds of articles made of gold, silver, and bronze.

verses.kjv: Them also king David dedicated unto the LORD, with the silver and the gold that he brought from all these nations; from Edom, and from Moab, and from the children of Ammon, and from the Philistines, and from Amalek.
verses.web: King David also dedicated these to LORD, with the silver and the gold that he carried away from all the nations; from Edom, from Moab, from the children of Ammon, from the Philistines, and from Amalek.
verses.ct: King David dedicated all of these to the LORD, along with the silver and gold he had taken from every nation he conquered — from Edom, Moab, the Ammonites, the Philistines, and Amalek.

verses.kjv: Moreover Abishai the son of Zeruiah slew of the Edomites in the valley of salt eighteen thousand.
verses.web: Moreover Abishai the son of Zeruiah struck eighteen thousand of the Edomites in the Valley of Salt.
verses.ct: Abishai son of Zeruiah killed 18,000 Edomites in the Valley of Salt.

verses.kjv: And he put garrisons in Edom; and all the Edomites became David’s servants. Thus the LORD preserved David whithersoever he went.
verses.web: He put garrisons in Edom; and all the Edomites became servants to David. LORD gave victory to David wherever he went.
verses.ct: He stationed garrisons throughout Edom, and all the Edomites became David's subjects. The LORD gave David victory everywhere he went.

verses.kjv: So David reigned over all Israel, and executed judgment and justice among all his people.
verses.web: David reigned over all Israel; and he executed justice and righteousness for all his people.
verses.ct: David ruled over all of Israel, and he governed his people with justice and fairness.

verses.kjv: And Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the host; and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud, recorder.
verses.web: Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the army; Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was recorder;
verses.ct: Joab son of Zeruiah commanded the army, and Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud served as the royal recorder.

verses.kjv: And Zadok the son of Ahitub, and Abimelech the son of Abiathar, were the priests; and Shavsha was scribe;
verses.web: Zadok the son of Ahitub, and Abimelech the son of Abiathar, were priests; Shavsha was scribe;
verses.ct: Zadok son of Ahitub and Abimelech son of Abiathar served as priests, and Shavsha was the royal secretary.

verses.kjv: And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and the sons of David were chief about the king.
verses.web: and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and the sons of David were chief officials serving the king.
verses.ct: Benaiah son of Jehoiada commanded the Cherethites and Pelethites, who served as the king's bodyguard. David's sons held the highest positions of authority at the king's side.
